# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True

unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update

======

bugs.title: CVE-2017-11640 ImageMagick: NULL pointer dereference in WritePTIFImage() in coders/tiff.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-11640 ImageMagick: NULL pointer dereference in WritePTIFImage() in coders/tiff.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11640 ImageMagick: NULL pointer dereference in WritePTIFImage() in coders/tiff.c

long_desc.thetext:
When ImageMagick 7.0.6-1 processes a crafted file in convert, it can
lead to an address access exception in the WritePTIFImage() function in
coders/tiff.c.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/584

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/1b811f7e7dad92b2992939f854201370a7d8084a
https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/46fe9920da054714d1d9c2c02a595f1fe733373d
https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/1fcd0feb93b51b9363176097ee5f360c62687d86

References:

https://bugzilla.novell.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1050632

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1475464]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

bugs.title: CVE-2017-11639 ImageMagick: heap-based buffer over-read in the WriteCIPImage() function in coders/cip.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-11639 ImageMagick: heap-based buffer over-read in the WriteCIPImage() function in coders/cip.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11639 ImageMagick: heap-based buffer over-read in the WriteCIPImage() function in coders/cip.c

long_desc.thetext:
When ImageMagick 7.0.6-1 processes a crafted file in convert, it can lead to a heap-based buffer over-read in the WriteCIPImage() function in coders/cip.c, related to the GetPixelLuma function in MagickCore/pixel-accessor.h.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/588

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/d0a4c1ff333d60984a5d6bdfd98774bfdd8a7cba
https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/8ec8ca4c61b1199b727cf52e440f3db79a5b0d0a
https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/65b7c57502bb2b6d22f607383e87cc3eaed94014

References:

https://bugzilla.novell.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1050635

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1475471]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1475470

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

OK then.

bugs.title: CVE-2017-11644 ImageMagick: Memory-Leak in ReadMATImage() coders/mat.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-11644 ImageMagick: Memory-Leak in ReadMATImage() coders/mat.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11644 ImageMagick: Memory-Leak in ReadMATImage() coders/mat.c

long_desc.thetext:
When ImageMagick 7.0.6-1 processes a crafted file in convert, it can
lead to a Memory Leak in the ReadMATImage() function in coders/mat.c.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/587

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/a6802e21d824e786d1e2a8440cf749a6e1a8d95f
https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/418f88dd18af34b6cb64f709567c81b89865d7bc

References:

https://bugzilla.novell.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1050606

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1475486]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1475485

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11724 ImageMagick: Memory leaks in ReadMATImage function involving the quantum_info and clone_info data structures

long_desc.thetext:
The ReadMATImage function in coders/mat.c in ImageMagick through
6.9.9-3 and 7.x through 7.0.6-3 has memory leaks involving the
quantum_info and clone_info data structures.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/624

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1477070]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11750 ImageMagick: NULL pointer dereference in ReadOneJNGImage function

long_desc.thetext:
The ReadOneJNGImage function in coders/png.c in ImageMagick 6.9.9-4 and
7.0.6-4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL
pointer dereference) via a crafted file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/632

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1477070]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11751 ImageMagick: Memory leak in WritePICONImage function

long_desc.thetext:
The WritePICONImage function in coders/xpm.c in ImageMagick 7.0.6-4
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory leak) via
a crafted file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/631

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1477070]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11752 ImageMagick: Memory leak in ReadMAGICKImage function

long_desc.thetext:
The ReadMAGICKImage function in coders/magick.c in ImageMagick 7.0.6-4
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory leak) via
a crafted file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/628

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1477070]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11753 ImageMagick: heap-based buffer over-read in GetImageDepth function

long_desc.thetext:
The GetImageDepth function in MagickCore/attribute.c in ImageMagick
7.0.6-4 might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service
(heap-based buffer over-read) via a crafted Flexible Image Transport
System (FITS) file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/629

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1477070]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11754 ImageMagick: Memory leak in WritePICONImage function

long_desc.thetext:
The WritePICONImage function in coders/xpm.c in ImageMagick 7.0.6-4
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory leak) via
a crafted file that is mishandled in an OpenPixelCache call.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/633

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1477070]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-11755 ImageMagick: Memory leak in WritePICONImage function via mishandled AcquireSemaphoreInfo call

long_desc.thetext:
The WritePICONImage function in coders/xpm.c in ImageMagick 7.0.6-4
allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory leak) via
a crafted file that is mishandled in an AcquireSemaphoreInfo call.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/634

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1477070]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1477058,1477062,1477063,1477064,1477066,1477068,1477069

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: CVE-2017-12140 ImageMagick: integer signedness error in ReadDCMImage function [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-12140 ImageMagick: integer signedness error in ReadDCMImage function [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-12140 ImageMagick: integer signedness error in ReadDCMImage function

long_desc.thetext:
The ReadDCMImage function in coders\dcm.c in ImageMagick 7.0.6-1 has an
integer signedness error leading to excessive memory consumption via a
crafted DCM file.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/533

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1477566]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1477565

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: CVE-2017-12418 ImageMagick: Memory leaks in the parse8BIMW and format8BIM functions in coders/meta.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-12418 ImageMagick: Memory leaks in the parse8BIMW and format8BIM functions in coders/meta.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-12418 ImageMagick: Memory leaks in the parse8BIMW and format8BIM functions in coders/meta.c

long_desc.thetext:
ImageMagick 7.0.6-5 has memory leaks in the parse8BIMW and format8BIM functions in coders/meta.c, related to the WriteImage function in MagickCore/constitute.c.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/643
https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/668

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/46382526a3f09cebf9f2af680fc55b2a668fcbef
https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/bfd93888beccf2eff49cc9abfa6b5167c9c9109d

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1482626]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1482625

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: CVE-2017-12427 CVE-2017-12428 CVE-2017-12429 CVE-2017-12430 CVE-2017-12432 ImageMagick: various flaws [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-12427 CVE-2017-12428 CVE-2017-12429 CVE-2017-12430 CVE-2017-12432 ImageMagick: various flaws [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-12428 ImageMagick: Memory leak in the function ReadWMFImage in coders/wmf.c

long_desc.thetext:
In ImageMagick 7.0.6-1, a memory leak vulnerability was found in the function ReadWMFImage in coders/wmf.c, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service in CloneDrawInfo in draw.c. 

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/544

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/b2b48d50300a9fbcd0aa0d9230fd6d7a08f7671e
https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/f37d26336bf13737db45e556c25fc098f8a8b277

References:

https://bugzilla.novell.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1052249
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=869713

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1482655]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-12427 GraphicsMagick, ImageMagick: Mermory leak in ProcessMSLScript coders/msl.c

long_desc.thetext:
The ProcessMSLScript function in coders/msl.c in ImageMagick before 6.9.9-5 and 7.x before 7.0.6-5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory leak) via a crafted file, related to the WriteMSLImage function.

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1482655]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1482628,1482650,1482652,1482653,1482654

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

@nerijus, cuneiform has been FTBFS since Fedora 23 and the maintainer is not responding. Upstream is also dead. The package may be retired from Fedora.
But yagf-0.9.5-4.fc26 requires cuneiform, so if the package rebuild is enough, it would be nice it was rebuilt.

@nerijus, the cuneiform package cannot be compiled. That is the problem. It is not due to ImageMagick. Please follow up in the Red Hat Bugzilla bug 1423317 if you wish to discuss this further or help.
OK then.

@anonymous 
Please use dnf update --enablerepo=rpmfusion-free-updates-testing for packages related to RPM Fusion.
we need this in stable to install other packages ...

@dhgutteridge I rebuilt emacs-25.3-3.fc26 against new ImageMagick once more which should fix the conflict.

Could people give this update karma again so that we can move it to stable faster? Otherwise we'll be running into more and more issues where packages get other updates that conflict with the rebuilds done here.
Could people give this update karma again so that we can move it to stable quickly? Thanks!
I already installed it and no regressions noted
We need two more positive karma points. Previous testers: Please provide karma again so this is pushed to stable. Thanks.
This has spent enough time in updates-testing now and has gotten sufficient testing. Submitted to stable now. Thanks for testing everybody!
This has spent enough time in updates-testing now and has gotten sufficient testing. Submitted to stable now. Thanks for testing everybody!

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

close_bugs=True

suggest_reboot=False

bugs.title: CVE-2017-12433 CVE-2017-12434 CVE-2017-12435 ImageMagick: various flaws [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-12433 CVE-2017-12434 CVE-2017-12435 ImageMagick: various flaws [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-12433 ImageMagick: Memory leak in ReadPESImage function in coders/pes.c

long_desc.thetext:
In ImageMagick 7.0.6-1, a memory leak vulnerability was found in the
function ReadPESImage in coders/pes.c, which allows attackers to cause
a denial of service, related to ResizeMagickMemory in memory.c.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/548

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/0a170d18390d3762586f164e6abe3c4766d14620

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1483132]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-12434 ImageMagick: Missing NULL check in ReadMATImage function in coders/mat.c

long_desc.thetext:
In ImageMagick 7.0.6-1, a missing NULL check vulnerability was found in
the function ReadMATImage in coders/mat.c, which allows attackers to
cause a denial of service (assertion failure) in DestroyImageInfo in
image.c.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/547

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/b76b2ffff70f2c314a069ea953f4a45b1e2ce5e6

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1483132]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-12435 ImageMagick: Memory exhaustion in ReadSUNImage function in coders/sun.c

long_desc.thetext:
In ImageMagick 7.0.6-1, a memory exhaustion vulnerability was found in
the function ReadSUNImage in coders/sun.c, which allows attackers to
cause a denial of service.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/543

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/44cb8dfd4cbe6fc475c863a5946cff64e34c2088

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1483132]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1483127,1483130,1483131

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: CVE-2017-12587 ImageMagick: Resource exhaustion in ReadPWPImage function in coders\pwp.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-12587 ImageMagick: Resource exhaustion in ReadPWPImage function in coders\pwp.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-12587 ImageMagick: Resource exhaustion in ReadPWPImage function in coders\pwp.c

long_desc.thetext:
ImageMagick 7.0.6-1 has a large loop vulnerability in the ReadPWPImage
function in coders\pwp.c.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/535

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/d4192df5eb03892089806d52a317cc3101856726

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1483575]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1483574

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

comment.text: This conflicts with https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-8f27031c8f if one already has that installed from updates-testing. (I do.)
How can it conflict? The upgrade path is clear and the patch wasn't there in the git repo. I wasn't even aware that someone released emacs in a mass update like that.

@jsynacek: Correction, yesterday it gave me an error when I tried to upgrade using Koji downloads, but I didn't know there was a new dependency. (The error messages weren't clear.) When pulling via the updates-testing repo dnf picks up compat-ImageMagick693-libs as a new dependency.

    Dependencies resolved.
    =======================================================================================================================================
     Package                                   Arch                  Version                          Repository                      Size
    =======================================================================================================================================

    Installing dependencies:
     compat-ImageMagick693-libs                x86_64                6.9.3.10-1.fc26                  updates-testing                2.1 M
    
    Transaction Summary
    =======================================================================================================================================
    Install  1 Package
    Upgrade  3 Packages

The previous version in updates-testing had increased its ImageMagick dependency requirement to 6.9.9.
@dhgutteridge Does that mean that it works for you now? It looks like it.
@jsynacek: Yes, it installs and works fine for me.
Could people give this update karma again so that we can move it to stable quickly? Thanks!
I already installed it and no regressions noted
This has spent enough time in updates-testing now and has gotten sufficient testing. Submitted to stable now. Thanks for testing everybody!

bugs.title: CVE-2017-14482 emacs: command injection flaw within "enriched mode" handling

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-14482 emacs: command injection flaw within "enriched mode" handling

long_desc.thetext:
Enriched mode implements an extension command to the text/enriched format called "x-display", which stores "display" text properties. It's possible to use this extension command to transparently execute arbitrary code in an Emacs process that opens a text/enriched file.

Upstream issue:

https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=28350

Upstream patch:

https://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/emacs.git/commit/?h=emacs-25&id=9ad0fcc54442a9a01d41be19880250783426db70

References:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q3/422

Created emacs tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1490410]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2017:2771 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:2771

Mitigation:

This issue can be mitigated by adding the following lines to the Emacs init file (for example ~/.emacs, ~/emacs.d/init.el, site-start.el) and avoiding options that would bypass normal initialization, like 'emacs -Q':

  ;; Mitigate CVE-2017-14482 in Emacs 25.2 and earlier
(require 'enriched)
(defun enriched-decode-display-prop (start end &optional param)
  (list start end))

comment.text: This conflicts with https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-8f27031c8f if one already has that installed from updates-testing. (I do.)
How can it conflict? The upgrade path is clear and the patch wasn't there in the git repo. I wasn't even aware that someone released emacs in a mass update like that.

@jsynacek: Correction, yesterday it gave me an error when I tried to upgrade using Koji downloads, but I didn't know there was a new dependency. (The error messages weren't clear.) When pulling via the updates-testing repo dnf picks up compat-ImageMagick693-libs as a new dependency.

    Installing dependencies:

comment.text: This conflicts with https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-8f27031c8f if one already has that installed from updates-testing. (I do.)
How can it conflict? The upgrade path is clear and the patch wasn't there in the git repo. I wasn't even aware that someone released emacs in a mass update like that.

@jsynacek: Correction, yesterday it gave me an error when I tried to upgrade using Koji downloads, but I didn't know there was a new dependency. (The error messages weren't clear.) When pulling via the updates-testing repo dnf picks up compat-ImageMagick693-libs as a new dependency.

    Dependencies resolved.
    =======================================================================================================================================
     Package                                   Arch                  Version                          Repository                      Size
    =======================================================================================================================================
    Upgrading:
     emacs                                     x86_64                1:25.3-1.fc26                    updates-testing                3.1 M
     emacs-common                              x86_64                1:25.3-1.fc26                    updates-testing                 38 M
     emacs-filesystem                          noarch                1:25.3-1.fc26                    updates-testing                 67 k
    Installing dependencies:
     compat-ImageMagick693-libs                x86_64                6.9.3.10-1.fc26                  updates-testing                2.1 M
    
    Transaction Summary
    =======================================================================================================================================
    Install  1 Package
    Upgrade  3 Packages

The previous version in updates-testing had increased its ImageMagick dependency requirement to 6.9.9.
@dhgutteridge Does that mean that it works for you now? It looks like it.
@jsynacek: Yes, it installs and works fine for me.
Could people give this update karma again so that we can move it to stable quickly? Thanks!
I already installed it and no regressions noted
This has spent enough time in updates-testing now and has gotten sufficient testing. Submitted to stable now. Thanks for testing everybody!

long_desc.thetext:
Latest upstream release: 25.3
Current version/release in rawhide: 25.2-10.fc28
URL: http://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/

Please consult the package updates policy before you issue an update to a stable branch: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Updates_Policy

More information about the service that created this bug can be found at: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Upstream_release_monitoring

Please keep in mind that with any upstream change, there may also be packaging changes that need to be made. Specifically, please remember that it is your responsibility to review the new version to ensure that the licensing is still correct and that no non-free or legally problematic items have been added upstream.

Based on the information from anitya:  https://release-monitoring.org/project/675/
One or more of the specfile's Sources is not a valid URL so we cannot automatically build the new version for you. Please use a URL in your Source declarations if possible.

comments.text: This has spent enough time in updates-testing now and has gotten sufficient testing. Submitted to stable now. Thanks for testing everybody!
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
Many security fixes, bug fixes, and other changes from the previous version 6.9.3.0. See the [6.9 branch ChangeLog](https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/blob/3fd358e2ac34977fda38a2cf4d88a1cb4dd2d7c7/ChangeLog).

Dependent packages are mostly straight rebuilds, a couple also include bugfix version updates.
